project_overview.name: Twitter Clone App
project_overview.description: Develop a functional web application that replicates core Twitter features, including posting tweets, following users, liking and retweeting, and displaying trending topics.
project_overview.team_size: 4-6 people (Backend Developers, Frontend Developers, UI/UX Designer, QA Tester)
objectives: Create a user-friendly platform for sharing short messages and engaging in online discussions.
Achieve a minimum of 1000 registered users within the first month of launch.
Implement robust backend infrastructure to handle a high volume of user interactions and data.
success_criteria: High user engagement metrics (e.g., average session duration, tweets per user).

phase1.name: Backend Development and API Design
phase1.overview: Build the core backend infrastructure, database schema, and API endpoints for the application.
objectives: Develop a RESTful API for handling user authentication, tweet creation, and other core functionalities.
Establish a scalable database schema to store user data, tweets, and relationships.
deliverables: Functional API endpoints with comprehensive documentation.

sub1.name: User Authentication and Authorization
sub1.description: Implement user registration, login, and secure authentication mechanisms.
tasks: Set up user registration and login endpoints.
Implement secure password hashing and storage.

dependencies: Selection of technology stack (e.g., programming language, database).
risks: Database performance issues under high load. Mitigation: Optimize database queries and implement caching.
Security vulnerabilities in API endpoints. Mitigation: Conduct thorough security testing and penetration testing.
milestones: Successful deployment of backend infrastructure to a staging environment.

phase2.name: Frontend Development and UI/UX Design
phase2.overview: Develop the user interface and user experience of the application, integrating with the backend API.
objectives: Create a visually appealing and intuitive user interface.
Implement core frontend functionalities, such as posting tweets, following users, and displaying feeds.
deliverables: Functional frontend application integrated with the backend API.

sub1.name: Tweet Feed Implementation
sub1.description: Develop the tweet feed functionality, allowing users to view and interact with tweets.
tasks: Fetch tweets from the backend API.
Display tweets in a chronological order.
Implement infinite scrolling for the feed.

risks: Cross-browser compatibility issues. Mitigation: Thorough cross-browser testing.
Performance issues with large datasets. Mitigation: Implement lazy loading and optimization techniques.
